title: Moving charge - force on proton and electron

content.question: A proton and an electron, which are very far away from each other, are traveling at the same speed when both enter the same uniform magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math>. Which of the following statements is correct about the paths of the two particles?

choices.label: Both the proton and electron will pass through the field undeflected.
Both the proton and electron will experience the same magnitude of force parallel to their direction of motion but in opposite directions from each other.
Both the proton and electron will experience the same magnitude of force perpendicular to their direction of motion but in opposite directions from each other.
The proton and electron will experience different magnitudes of force in opposite directions from each other.

content.answer: Both the proton and electron will experience the same magnitude of force perpendicular to their direction of motion but in opposite directions from each other.
